Core Modules

articles.apps module

class articles.apps.ArticlesConfig(app_name, app_module)[source]

Bases: AppConfig

App configuration for the articles app. Ensures signal handlers are registered when the app is ready.

default_auto_field = 'django.db.models.BigAutoField'
name = 'articles'
ready()[source]

Override this method in subclasses to run code when Django starts.

articles.admin module

class articles.admin.ArticleAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: ModelAdmin

Admin for Article model.

date_hierarchy = 'created_at'
list_display = ('title', 'author', 'publisher', 'approved', 'created_at')
list_filter = ('approved', 'publisher', 'created_at')
property media
ordering = ('-created_at',)
search_fields = ('title', 'content')
class articles.admin.CustomUserAdmin(model, admin_site)[source]

Bases: UserAdmin

Custom admin for the CustomUser model with role display.

add_fieldsets = ((None, {'classes': ('wide',), 'fields': ('username', 'usable_password', 'password1', 'password2')}), ('Role & Subscriptions', {'fields': ('role',)}))
fieldsets = ((None, {'fields': ('username', 'password')}), ('Personal info', {'fields': ('first_name', 'last_name', 'email')}), ('Permissions', {'fields': ('is_active', 'is_staff', 'is_superuser', 'groups', 'user_permissions')}), ('Important dates', {'fields': ('last_login', 'date_joined')}), ('Role & Subscriptions', {'fields': ('role', 'subscribed_publishers', 'subscribed_journalists')}))
list_display = ('username', 'email', 'role', 'is_staff', 'is_active')
list_filter = ('role', 'is_staff', 'is_active')
property media
model

alias of CustomUser

ordering = ('username',)
search_fields = ('username', 'email')

Models & Forms

articles.models module

class articles.models.Article(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

News article submitted by a journalist.

Articles belong to a publisher and may be approved by an editor. Each article includes: - Title, content, and optional summary. - Author (journalist) and publisher. - Approval status and timestamps.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

approved

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

class articles.models.CustomUser(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: AbstractUser

Custom user model extending Djangos AbstractUser.

Adds role-based access control and subscription relationships: - Roles: reader, editor, journalist, publisher. - Readers can subscribe to publishers and journalists. - Publishers, editors, and journalists are linked to publishing workflows.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

ROLE_CHOICES = [('reader', 'Reader'), ('editor', 'Editor'), ('journalist', 'Journalist'), ('publisher', 'Publisher')]

class articles.models.Newsletter(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Periodic newsletter authored by a journalist.

Newsletters include: - Title, content, and optional summary. - Author (journalist). - Related articles (many-to-many). - Creation and update timestamps.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

class articles.models.Publisher(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Model

Represents a publishing entity.

A publisher has: - An owner (must have role publisher). - Associated editors and journalists. - A name and description for identification.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

articles.forms module

class articles.forms.ArticleForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating and updating Article objects.

Includes fields: - Title - Content - Publisher (must exist before assignment)

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

fields = ['title', 'content', 'publisher']
help_texts = {'publisher': 'Select the publisher for this article. If none exist, please register one first.'}
labels = {'content': 'Content', 'publisher': 'Publishing House', 'title': 'Article Title'}
model

alias of Article

base_fields = {'content': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'publisher': <django.forms.models.ModelChoiceField object>, 'title': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}
declared_fields = {}
property media

Return all media required to render the widgets on this form.

class articles.forms.CustomUserCreationForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: UserCreationForm

Form for creating new users with role assignment.

Extends Djangos built-in UserCreationForm to include: - Username - Email - Role (reader, journalist, editor, publisher)

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

fields = ('username', 'email', 'role')
help_texts = {'role': 'Select your role: reader, journalist, editor, or publisher.'}
labels = {'email': 'Email Address', 'role': 'User Role', 'username': 'Username'}
model

alias of CustomUser

declared_fields = {'password1': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>, 'password2': <django.forms.fields.CharField object>}

class articles.forms.NewsletterForm(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ModelForm

Form for creating and updating Newsletter objects.

Includes fields: - Title - Content - Articles (many-to-many, selectable via checkboxes)

class Meta[source]

Bases: object

fields = ['title', 'content', 'articles']
help_texts = {'articles': 'Select one or more articles to include in this newsletter.', 'content': 'Write the full content of the newsletter.', 'title': 'Enter a clear, descriptive title for the newsletter.'}
labels = {'articles': 'Articles', 'content': 'Content', 'title': 'Newsletter Title'}
model

Views & URLs

articles.views module

articles.views.approve_article(request, pk)[source]

Allow an editor to approve an article.

If the article is not already approved, mark it as approved and optionally post it to Twitter/X using the utility function.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) The incoming request.

  • pk (int) Primary key of the article.

Returns:

Redirect to the editor dashboard.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

articles.views.delete_article(request, pk)[source]

Allow an editor to delete an article.

Editors may delete only unapproved articles. Approved articles are protected.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) The incoming request.

  • pk (int) Primary key of the article.

Returns:

Confirmation page or redirect to editor dashboard.

Return type:

HttpResponse

articles.views.get_subscribed_articles(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]

API endpoint: Return all approved articles from publishers and journalists the reader is subscribed to.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) The incoming request.

Returns:

JSON list of subscribed articles or error if not a reader.

Response

articles.urls module

Utilities & Signals

articles.utils module

articles.utils.post_to_twitter(article)[source]

Post a new article announcement to Twitter using Tweepy v2 Client.

Expects the following settings to be defined in settings.py: - TWITTER_API_KEY - TWITTER_API_SECRET - TWITTER_ACCESS_TOKEN - TWITTER_ACCESS_SECRET - (optional) TWITTER_BEARER_TOKEN - (optional) TWITTER_PREFIX - (optional) TWITTER_ENABLED - (optional) DEFAULT_DOMAIN (used if Sites framework is not enabled)

articles.signals module

articles.signals.create_default_groups(sender, **kwargs)[source]

Creates default user groups (Reader, Editor, Journalist) and assigns role-specific permissions after migrations for the articles app only.

articles.signals.notify_followers_on_approval(sender, instance, created, **kwargs)[source]

Sends email notifications to readers who follow the journalist when an article is approved.
